title: Client Randomly Tabs Out during the game, no office installed (task scheduler fix doesn't work)
body:
So, I have the problem that my client randomly tabs out of the game.

After using google and searching here in the forum it seems like office is causing the issue.
I don't have office though, so something else seems to be the problem.

Reinstalling the client didn't solve the issue.

Every now and then when tabbing out I get a ram error, last time I tried to capture the screen with print it didn't work though. 
I played a custom game for about 20 minutes, but didn't get the error again. Next time I see it, I include a picture in this post.

Any Ideas what I should do?

Best regards,
Gullberg

replies.body:
Let's try running a clean boot, just in case, to make entirely sure nothing outside of the game is causing League to minimize for some reason.

https://i.gyazo.com/f7b67eb5f5d09c7ef9da3a6f6e118927.png

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=b2ugyl0q,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-12-29T01:30:29.687+0000)
>
> Let's try running a clean boot, just in case, to make entirely sure nothing outside of the game is causing League to minimize for some reason.
> 
> https://i.gyazo.com/f7b67eb5f5d09c7ef9da3a6f6e118927.png

Hi, thanks for your help so far. I solved the issue, it was a not working graphics card driver.

Every now and then, my fps drop to 0 and I get a frozen screen.

Does running a clean boot help with this problem too?

Are you playing on an older computer? Dust accumulates over time, and a simply reseating your ram can fix some issues. How much RAM does your computer have? If you have a small amount of RAM, you might want to consider adding more. Do you have anything else open in the background while you're playing when this occurs? For example, something that takes away the focus from the game by requiring user input.

My laptop is a brandnew gaming laptop, 8 gb ram, windows 10 64 bit, nvidia geforce 1050, i5-7300 HQ

My game worked perfect until last patch, 150+ fps, no problems whatsoever.

I reinstalled my nvidia drivers, maybe that helps

I have nothing else open but my kaspersky internet security and teamspeak from time to time. Even without TS, the error occured.
